  :ARG0 i
  :ARG1 (s / see-01
          :ARG1 (p / paycheck
                  :poss i
                  :mod (a / any)
                  :ARG0-of (s2 / support-01
                             :ARG1 (p2 / person
                                     :mod (l / lazy)
                                     :mod (s3 / some)
                                     :ARG0-of (w2 / work-01
                                                :polarity -
                                                :ARG1-of (c / cause-01
                                                           :ARG0 (p3 / pay-01

                                                                           :ARG0-of (g2 / govern-01))
                                                                   :ARG2 p2
                                                                   :ARG3 (l2 / live-01
                                                                           :ARG0 p2))))))))
  :time (e / ever
          :polarity -)
  :ord (o / ordinal-entity
         :value "-1")
  :mod (i / important
         :degree (m / most)))

                                    :quant (a3 / all)))))

            :op1 (u / until)))

                        :degree (m3 / more)

                        :mod (v3 / variety)))

                        :consist-of (o2 / ozone))

                              :mod (o4 / only)
                              :beneficiary (e3 / environmentalist))
                        :mod (e8 / environment))
                  :ARG1 (m5 / money
                        :degree (m6 / most))))
      :snt5 (g3 / get-01
            :ARG0 (c7 / company
                  :mod (o5 / oil))

                  :poss c7)

                        :poss y2)

# ::id DF-170-181114-902_4264.5 ::date 2013-09-26T14:04:20 ::annotator LDC-AMR-14 ::preferred
# ::snt In reality humans contribute about 5% to global worming in terms of CO2 release into the atmosphere. Yes it is true that we are responsible for this number and trying to minimize it in whatever way we can, but humans are not ultimately the source of global worming. It is arrogant of us to think that we can effect the ecosystem of the world in such a drastic way in only 20 years. Science is divided on the issues with scientists in government labs reporting that global warming is an imminent threat caused by humans and only we can save the planet while scientists at universities and private organizations generally suggest that man is not the ultimate cause and in reality contributes little. The IPCC has published documentation and recommendations about global warming at regular intervals and it was not until one of their more recent publications that they completely overturned their previous data showing global warming to be natural in favor of new data that showed global warming to be human caused. The problem is that they used the same relative data set and simply changed the way it is viewed to maximize the human contribution. They have also been known to falsify information to suit their purposes and destroy information that proves them incorrect.

# ::id DF-170-181118-887_5920.14 ::date 2013-09-29T06:17:45 ::annotator LDC-AMR-14 ::preferred
# ::snt Back in April, 2003 the Army was making the initial advance to capture Baghdad Int'l airport, Victor and his wingmen found an Iraqi ambush site of about 12 APCs that were less than a mile from the Army advance.
# ::save-date Sun Jan 26, 2014 ::file DF-170-181118-887_5920_14.txt
(f / find-01
      :ARG0 (a2 / and
            :op1 (p / person :name (n / name :op1 "Victor"))
            :op2 (p2 / person
                  :ARG0-of (h / have-org-role-91
                        :ARG2 (w / wingman
                              :poss p))))
      :ARG1 (s / site
            :purpose (a4 / ambush-01)
            :consist-of (v / vehicle :name (n2 / name :op1 "APC")
                  :quant (a / about :op1 12)
                  :location (r / relative-position
                        :op1 (l2 / location
                              :location-of a3)
                        :quant (l / less-than
                              :op1 (d3 / distance-quantity :quant 1
                                    :unit (m / mile))
                              :prep-from a3)))
            :mod (c2 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "Iraq")))
      :time (d / date-entity :month 4 :year 2003
            :mod (b / back))
      :time (a3 / advance-01
            :ARG1 (m2 / military :name (n3 / name :op1 "Army"))
            :purpose (c / capture-01
                  :ARG0 m2
                  :ARG1 (a5 / airport :name (n4 / name :op1 "Baghdad" :op2 "International" :op3 "Airport")))
            :mod (i / initial)))

# ::id DF-170-181118-887_5920.15 ::date 2013-09-29T06:28:37 ::annotator LDC-AMR-14 ::preferred

            :ARG0-of (p3 / prohibit-01
                  :ARG1 (d / deploy-01
                        :ARG0 p
                        :ARG1 (w2 / weapon
                              :poss p))))
      :time (t / that))

# ::id DF-170-181118-887_5920.16 ::date 2013-09-29T06:35:50 ::annotator LDC-AMR-14 ::preferred

                        :poss a
                        :quant (a3 / all)))
            :op2 (d2 / destroy-01
                  :ARG0 a
                  :ARG1 (v / vehicle :quant 8 :name (n / name :op1 "APC")

                              :ARG1 (m3 / military :name (n2 / name :op1 "United" :op2 "States" :op3 "Army"))

                                    :poss m3
                                    :purpose (t4 / take-01
                                          :ARG0 m3
                                          :ARG1 (a5 / airport :name (n3 / name :op1 "Baghdad" :op2 "International" :op3 "Airport"))))))))
      :time (w3 / within
            :op1 (t3 / timespan
                  :duration (b / between
                        :op1 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 20
                              :unit (m / minute))
                        :op2 (t2 / temporal-quantity :quant 30
                              :unit (m2 / minute))))))

# ::id DF-170-181118-887_5920.19 ::date 2013-09-29T07:23:54 ::annotator LDC-AMR-14 ::preferred
# ::snt Because this hero was 2 years away from retirement and is being discharged, against his will, from the Air Force. Is this because of bad behavior? No. He has an excellent record of service and has never had any problems. Then why, if this 18-year veteran who is an excellent Pilot of the US Air Force being discharged against his will, 2 years before he retires?
# ::save-date Sun Jan 26, 2014 ::file DF-170-181118-887_5920_19.txt
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (a / and
            :op1 (r / retire-01
                  :ARG0 (h / hero
                        :mod (t2 / this))
                  :time (a3 / away
                        :op1 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 2
                              :unit (y / year))))
            :op2 (d2 / dismiss-01
                  :ARG1 h
                  :ARG2 (m2 / military :name (n2 / name :op1 "Air" :op2 "Force"))
                  :ARG0-of (o / oppose-01
                        :ARG1 (w / will
                              :poss h)))
            :ARG1-of (c2 / cause-01))
      :snt2 (c / cause-01 :mode interrogative
            :ARG0 (b2 / behave-01
                  :ARG1 (b3 / bad)))
      :snt3 (n / no)
      :snt4 (a2 / and
            :op1 (h2 / have-03
                  :ARG0 (h3 / he)
                  :ARG1 (r2 / record
                        :mod (e / excellent)
                        :topic (s / serve-01)))
            :op2 (h4 / have-03 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 h3
                  :ARG1 (p / problem
                        :quant (a5 / any))
                  :time (e2 / ever)))
      :snt5 (a6 / amr-unknown
            :ARG0-of (c3 / cause-01
                  :ARG1 (d / dismiss-01
                        :ARG1 (p2 / person
                              :ARG0-of (h5 / have-org-role-91
                                    :ARG2 (v / veteran
                                          :duration (t3 / temporal-quantity :quant 18
                                                :unit (y2 / year))))
                              :ARG0-of (h6 / have-org-role-91
                                    :ARG1 (m3 / military :name (n3 / name :op1 "United" :op2 "States" :op3 "Air" :op4 "Force"))
                                    :ARG2 (p3 / pilot
                                          :mod (e3 / excellent))))
                        :ARG0-of (o2 / oppose-01
                              :ARG1 (w2 / will
                                    :poss p2))
                        :time (b4 / before
                              :op1 (r3 / retire-01
                                    :ARG0 p2)
                              :quant (t4 / temporal-quantity :quant 2
                                    :unit (y3 / year)))))))

      :ARG1 (s / solution
            :ARG0-of (a / allow-01
                  :ARG1 (e / enlist-01

                        :ARG1 (y / you)))))

            :domain (s / subject-01
                  :ARG0 (h / he)
                  :ARG1 h
                  :ARG2 (p2 / punish-01
                        :ARG1 h)))
      :condition (c / correct-01
            :ARG1 (v / view-02
                  :ARG0 (r / religion)
                  :ARG1 (s2 / suicide)
                  :ARG2 (s3 / sin-01))))

# ::id DF-199-192772-681_0232.10 ::date 2013-09-04T20:18:02 ::annotator UCO-AMR-05 ::preferred

      :ARG1 (t / thing

                        :ARG0 (b / biology)
                        :ARG1 h

                              :op1 (l2 / live-01
                                    :ARG0 h)

                                          :ARG1 h))))

      :manner (w2 / way
            :mod (e3 / either))

# ::snt Bachmann also has an ownership stake in Waumandee, Wisconsin farm land. From 1995 through 2006, the tenant-farmer received $251,973 in federal subsidies, chiefly for dairy and corn price supports."
# ::save-date Mon Sep 16, 2013 ::file DF-199-192783-683_4157_4.txt
(m2 / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (o / own-01
            :ARG0 (p / person :name (n / name :op1 "Bachmann"))
            :ARG1 (l / land
                  :purpose (f / farm-01)
                  :location (c / city :name (n2 / name :op1 "Waumandee")
                        :location (s / state :name (n3 / name :op1 "Wisconsin")))
                  :quant (s2 / stake))
            :mod (a3 / also))
      :snt2 (r / rent-02
            :ARG1 (a / and
                  :op1 l
                  :op2 (b / building
                        :location l))
            :ARG2 (p2 / person
                  :ARG0-of (f2 / farm-01
                        :mod (t / tenant))
                  :ARG1-of (n4 / neighbor-01)
                  :ARG0-of (m3 / maintain-01
                        :ARG1 (h / herd
                              :purpose (d4 / dairy))
                        :location l))
            :time (s3 / since
                  :op1 (d5 / die-01
                        :ARG1 (f3 / father-in-law
                              :poss p))))
      :snt3 (s4 / subsidize-01
            :ARG0 (g / government-organization :name (n5 / name :op1 "Federal"))
            :ARG1 p2
            :instrument (m / monetary-quantity :quant 251973
                  :unit (d3 / dollar))
            :ARG1-of (c2 / cause-01
                  :ARG0 (s5 / support-01
                        :ARG1 (a2 / and
                              :op1 (p3 / price-01
                                    :ARG1 (d6 / dairy))
                              :op2 (p4 / price-01
                                    :ARG1 (c4 / corn))))
                  :extent (c3 / chiefly))
            :time (d7 / date-interval
                  :op1 (d / date-entity :year 1995)
                  :op2 (d2 / date-entity :year 2006))))

Instead, School-to-Work utilizes the school day to promote children's acquisition of workplace skills, viewing children as trainees for increased economic productivity."*

                        :ARG0 (o2 / or

                              :ARG0 o2

                                    :op1 (s2 / source
                                          :ARG0-of (c2 / check-01
                                                :ARG1 (f / fact)))))
                        :time (e / ever)))))

# ::id DF-199-192794-661_0184.4 ::date 2013-08-14T23:40:53 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred
# ::snt Any tips, suggestions, etc., about what to expect during first few days, how to manage, sleep, any info.
# ::save-date Wed Sep 18, 2013 ::file DF-199-192794-661_0184_4.txt
(a / and
      :op1 (t / tip-05
            :ARG2 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (t2 / thing
                        :ARG1-of (e / expect-01
                              :duration (f2 / few
                                    :op1 (t5 / temporal-quantity :quant 1
                                          :unit (d / day))
                                    :ord (o / ordinal-entity :value 1))))
                  :op2 (t3 / thing
                        :manner-of (m2 / manage-01))
                  :op3 (t4 / thing
                        :manner-of (s2 / sleep-01)))
            :mod (a5 / any))
      :op2 (s / suggest-01
            :ARG1 a2
            :mod a5)
      :op3 (i / info
            :mod a5)
      :op4 (e2 / et-cetera))

# ::id DF-199-192794-661_0184.6 ::date 2013-08-15T00:12:39 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred
# ::snt I had suffered low grade "bursitis" in one shoulder for many years (probably a worn rotator cuff), until one day while working out I got a real, full tear.
# ::save-date Wed Sep 18, 2013 ::file DF-199-192794-661_0184_6.txt

      :ARG0 (i / i)

            :mod (g / grade
                  :mod (l / low))
            :location (s2 / shoulder
                  :quant (o / one))

                  :ARG1 (p / probable
                        :domain (w / wear-06
                              :ARG1 (c / cuff
                                    :mod (r / rotate-01))))))
      :time (u / until
            :op1 (g2 / get-01
                  :ARG0 i
                  :ARG1 (t2 / tear-01
                        :mod (r2 / real)
                        :mod (f / full))
                  :time (w2 / work-03
                        :ARG0 i
                        :time (d / day
                              :mod (o2 / one)))))
      :duration (m3 / many
            :op1 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 1
                  :unit (y / year))))

                        :time (p2 / post
                              :op1 (o / operative))))))

# ::id DF-199-192794-661_0184.10 ::date 2013-08-15T01:36:44 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred
# ::snt I was determined to restore the range of motion and to return to my old exercise routine, so I in effect took charge of the rehab program and made it clear to the therapist the Orthopedic Surgeon that I wouldn't accept less.
# ::save-date Tue Aug 20, 2013 ::file DF-199-192794-661_0184_10.txt

                  :ARG4 (r4 / routine
                        :mod (e / exercise-02
                              :ARG0 i)
                        :mod (o / old))))
      :ARG0-of (c / cause-01
            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (t / take-01
                        :ARG0 i
                        :ARG1 (c2 / charge-05
                              :ARG2 (p / program
                                    :mod (r5 / rehab)))
                        :prep-in (e2 / effect))
                  :op2 (c3 / clarify-01
                        :ARG0 i
                        :ARG1 (a3 / accept-01 :polarity -
                              :ARG0 i
                              :ARG1 (l / less))
                        :ARG2 (a4 / and
                              :op1 (t2 / therapist)
                              :op2 (s / surgeon
                                    :mod (o2 / orthopedic)))))))

# ::id DF-199-192794-661_0184.11 ::date 2013-08-15T02:19:24 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred
# ::snt In retrospect I believe this was the critical thing, in that the Docs. and the therapists take their cues from the patient -- if you passively accept less than full recovery, they will let you go.
# ::save-date Fri Jan 17, 2014 ::file DF-199-192794-661_0184_11.txt
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (b / believe-01
            :ARG0 (i / i)
            :ARG1 (t3 / thing
                  :mod (c / critical)
                  :domain (t / take-01
                        :ARG0 (a / and
                              :op1 (d / doctor)
                              :op2 (t4 / therapist))
                        :ARG1 (c2 / cue)
                        :ARG2 (p / patient
                              :poss a)))
            :manner (r / retrospect))
      :snt2 (l / let-01
            :ARG0 (t5 / they)
            :ARG1 (g / go-01
                  :ARG1 (y / you))
            :condition (a2 / accept-01
                  :ARG0 y
                  :ARG1 (l2 / less
                        :compared-to (r2 / recover-01
                              :degree (f / full)))
                  :manner (p2 / passive))))

                              :ARG1-of (i2 / intend-01))
                        :domain c)))
      :medium (l / link
            :mod (t / that))
      :mod (w / well :mode expressive))

                  :extent (p3 / percentage-entity :value 87))
            :ARG2 (h / have-03

                        :ARG1-of (r2 / range-01

                                    :unit (y / year))
                              :ARG4 (t4 / temporal-quantity :quant 49
                                    :unit (y2 / year))))

                        :ARG1-of (l / lessen-01))
                  :mod (o / only))))

# ::id DF-199-192821-670_8251.2 ::date 2013-08-16T07:54:49 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred

                                          :mod (c3 / crime))))))

                  :op1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "Australia"))
                  :op2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Great" :op2 "Britain")
                        :ARG1-of (b / believe-01
                              :ARG0 (i / i))
                        :mod (a3 / at-least
                              :degree (v / very))))
            :ARG1-of (h / have-concession-91
                  :ARG2 (o / or
                        :op1 (v2 / victim
                              :ARG1-of (a2 / allege-01)
                              :domain j)
                        :op2 (p / person
                              :ARG1-of a2
                              :ARG0-of (p2 / perpetrate-01)
                              :domain j)))
            :ARG2-of (e / except-00
                  :ARG1 (c4 / circumstance
                        :mod (s / special
                              :degree (v3 / very))))
            :li (i3 / i)))

# ::id DF-199-192821-670_8251.3 ::date 2013-08-16T08:22:31 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred

                                    :ARG1 t))
                        :ARG2 (p2 / public)))
            :op2 (m / murder-01
                  :ARG0 t)
            :op3 (a6 / and
                  :op1 (a3 / allege-01
                        :ARG1 (c3 / commit-02
                              :ARG0 (t2 / they)
                              :ARG1 (c2 / crime
                                    :mod (s2 / serious
                                          :degree (v / very)))))
                  :op2 (t3 / try-02
                        :ARG0 t2
                        :manner (a5 / adult)))
            :op4 (h2 / have-purpose-91
                  :ARG1 (i2 / it)
                  :ARG2 (i / interest
                        :mod (p3 / public))
                  :manner (w / way
                        :mod (s3 / some)))))

# ::save-date Wed Sep 18, 2013 ::file DF-199-192823-675_9881_7.txt
(m / multi-sentence
  :snt1 (t / think-01
          :ARG0 (i / i)
          :ARG1 (p / possible
                  :domain (d / detail-01
                            :example (a / and
                                       :op1 (a3 / and
                                              :op1 (t2 / thing
                                                     :ARG1-of (h / happen-01))
                                              :op2 (t6 / thing
                                                     :time-of h))
                                       :op2 (p2 / person
                                              :ARG0-of (t3 / try-01
                                                         :ARG1 (d2 / do-02
                                                                 :ARG1 (t4 / thing))))
                                       :op3 (e / et-cetera))
                            :manner (s / spread-03
                                      :ARG1 (p3 / propaganda
                                              :poss (h2 / he))
                                      :polarity -))))
  :snt2 (c / cause-01
          :ARG1 (t5 / that
                  :domain (i3 / it))))

# ::id DF-199-192823-675_9881.10 ::date 2013-08-20T00:24:36 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred

      :op1 (n / need-01 :polarity -
            :ARG1 (r / rest))
      :op2 (a2 / and
            :op1 (a3 / article
                  :ARG1-of (l / link-01
                        :ARG0 (a6 / and

                        :purpose (a5 / argue-01
                              :ARG0 a2

                                    :ARG0 (p / propaganda)

                        :unit (w / week))))

                              :poss n3)))
            :time (n4 / now)
            :quant (a3 / all)))

                                    :topic (a / art))))

                        :manner (p4 / pain-01 :polarity -)))))

                        :purpose (p / pick-01

                                          :ARG1 i

                                                      :degree (m2 / much :polarity -
                                                            :mod (a5 / as)))))))
                        :mod (g2 / good
                              :mod (p2 / perfect))
                        :domain (t3 / this))
                  :ARG2 i))
      :snt2 (q / quarterback
            :domain (p3 / person :name (n4 / name :op1 "Sanchez"))
            :poss i))

                                    :mod (c4 / chicken)))

                        :condition (t / team

                                    :ARG2 (t2 / team
                                          :poss i)
                                    :ARG3 1)
                              :ARG0-of (m2 / make-18
                                    :ARG1 g))))))

# ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.1 ::date 2013-08-21T08:26:03 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred
# ::snt in an article in toronto's "globe and mail" newspaper, John Polanyi, a Nobel laureate and member of the Department of Chemistry at the University of Toronto, recommends that afghanistan farmers be allowed(you might even say "be encouraged") to grow poppies (opium) legally.
# ::save-date Mon Sep 16, 2013 ::file DF-199-192909-666_9414_1.txt
(r / recommend-01
      :ARG0 (p / person :name (n / name :op1 "John" :op2 "Polanyi")
            :ARG0-of (h / have-org-role-91
                  :ARG1 (o / organization :name (n2 / name :op1 "Department" :op2 "of" :op3 "Chemistry")
                        :part-of (u / university :name (n3 / name :op1 "University" :op2 "of" :op3 "Toronto")))
                  :ARG2 (m / member))
            :mod (l / laureate
                  :mod (n4 / Nobel)))
      :ARG1 (a3 / allow-01
            :ARG1 (g / grow-03
                  :ARG0 (p3 / person
                        :ARG0-of (f / farm-01)
                        :mod (c2 / country :name (n8 / name :op1 "Afghanistan")))
                  :ARG1 (p4 / poppy
                        :ARG0-of (m3 / mean-01
                              :ARG1 (o2 / opium)))
                  :manner (l2 / law))
            :ARG0-of (m2 / mean-01
                  :ARG1 (p2 / possible
                        :domain (s / say-01
                              :ARG0 (y / you)
                              :ARG1 (e2 / encourage-01
                                    :ARG1 p3)
                              :mod (e / even)))))
      :medium (a2 / article
            :part-of (n5 / newspaper :name (n6 / name :op1 "Globe" :op2 "and" :op3 "Mail")
                  :poss (c / city :name (n7 / name :op1 "Toronto")))))

                        :mod (p3 / particular)))

                  :domain (s2 / supply-01
                        :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n / name :op1 "Afghanistan"))
                        :ARG1 (p4 / poppy

                                                      :manner (c3 / commercial))))))))))

                                    :mod l)))))

                  :domain (b / buy-01
                        :ARG0 w

                        :ARG1 (d2 / drug
                              :ARG0-of (k / kill-01
                                    :ARG1 (p6 / pain))))
                  :ARG2 h)))

                        :example (a3 / and

                              :mod (s2 / some))))))

                              :mod (l / legitimate)
                              :ARG0-of (m4 / manufacture-01)))))
      :manner (u / unfortunate))

# ::id DF-199-192909-666_9414.13 ::date 2013-08-21T08:48:46 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred
# ::snt There would be problems though.

# ::save-date Tue Aug 27, 2013 ::file DF-199-192909-667_1320_4.txt
(i / instance :mode interrogative
      :domain (t / threaten-01
            :ARG1 (s / sanction))
      :mod (a / another)
      :location-of (b / blow-01
            :ARG0 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "US"))
                  :op2 (o / organization :name (n2 / name :op1 "UN")))
            :ARG1 (s2 / smoke)
            :manner (j / just)))

# ::id DF-199-192909-667_1320.5 ::date 2013-08-22T16:21:19 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred
# ::snt It's blowing smoke as it's the people who will end up suffering from any such move.
# ::save-date Thu Aug 22, 2013 ::file DF-199-192909-667_1320_5.txt
(s / smoke
      :ARG1-of (b / blow-01)
      :domain (i / it)
      :compared-to (p / person
            :domain (i2 / it)
            :ARG1-of (e / end-02
                  :ARG4 (s2 / suffer-01
                        :ARG0 p
                        :ARG1 (m / move-03
                              :manner (s3 / such
                                    :mod (a / any)))))))

# ::id DF-199-192909-667_1320.6 ::date 2013-08-22T07:46:19 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred
# ::snt If the UN really wants to make a difference, they could threaten to pass a resolution!!!!!
# ::save-date Fri Jan 17, 2014 ::file DF-199-192909-667_1320_6.txt
(p / possible
      :domain (t / threaten-01
            :ARG0 o
            :ARG1 (p2 / pass-01
                  :ARG1 (r / resolution)))
      :condition (w / want-01
            :ARG0 (o / organization :name (n / name :op1 "UN"))
            :ARG1 (m / make-01
                  :ARG0 o
                  :ARG1 (d / differ-02))
            :mod (r2 / really)))

      :snt1 (o / Ooooooh :mode expressive)
      :snt2 (o2 / obligate-01
            :ARG0 (t / that)
            :ARG2 (s / scare-01
                  :ARG0 t
                  :ARG1 (t2 / they))))

# ::id DF-199-192909-667_1340.2 ::date 2013-08-28T06:48:58 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred

# ::save-date Wed Sep 18, 2013 ::file DF-199-192909-667_1340_2.txt
(a / and
      :op1 (g2 / go-02
            :ARG0 (i / i)
            :ARG4 (t2 / there)
            :frequency (f3 / few)
            :time (o2 / or
                  :op1 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 6
                        :unit (y / year)
                        :mod (l / last))
                  :op2 (t4 / temporal-quantity :quant 7
                        :unit (y2 / year)
                        :mod l)))
      :op2 (f / familiarize-01
            :ARG1 i
            :ARG2 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (p / person
                        :mod t2)
                  :op2 (c / custom)
                  :op3 (g / geography)
                  :op4 (c2 / challenge
                        :mod (u / unique))
                  :mod t2)))

            :op1 (v / visit-01

                  :ord (o / ordinal-entity :value 1))))

# ::id DF-199-192909-667_1340.9 ::date 2013-09-02T07:33:21 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred

# ::save-date Fri Jan 17, 2014 ::file DF-199-192909-667_1340_9.txt

      :ARG0 (i3 / i)
      :ARG1 (t / thread
            :mod (t2 / this))
      :ARG2 (d / discuss-01
            :ARG1 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (a4 / and
                        :op1 (a2 / and
                              :op1 (t3 / thing
                                    :mod (n / new)
                                    :ARG1-of (d2 / develop-02))
                              :op2 (i / initiative
                                    :topic (e / economy))
                              :location (c / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Morocco"))
                              :time (c2 / come-06
                                    :ARG1 a2
                                    :medium (n3 / news))))
                  :op2 (n4 / news
                        :mod (a5 / any)
                        :mod (o / other)
                        :ARG1-of (d3 / deem-01
                              :mod (c3 / curious)
                              :mod (i2 / interest))))
            :time (p / periodical)))

                                    :ARG1 b)))
                  :op2 (i2 / invent-01
                        :ARG0 a
                        :ARG1 a3))))
